nl.esciencecenter.octopus.files

Interface FileSystem


  • public interface FileSystem
    FileSystem represent a (possibly remote) file system that can be used to access data.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Maassen

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getAdaptorName()
      Get the name of the adaptor attached to this FileSystem.
      AbsolutePath getEntryPath()
      Get the entry path of this file system.
      Properties getProperties()
      Get the properties used to create this FileSystem.
      URI getUri()
      Get the URI representing the location of the FileSystem.

    • Method Detail

      • getAdaptorName

        String getAdaptorName()
        Get the name of the adaptor attached to this FileSystem.
        Returns:
        the name of the adaptor.

      • getUri

        URI getUri()
        Get the URI representing the location of the FileSystem.
        Returns:
        the location of the FileSystem.

      • getProperties

        Properties getProperties()
        Get the properties used to create this FileSystem.
        Returns:
        the properties used to create this FileSystem.

      • getEntryPath

        AbsolutePath getEntryPath()
        Get the entry path of this file system. The entry path is the initial path when the FileSystem is first accessed, for example "/home/username".
        Returns:
        the entry path of this file system.
